nutanix_redeploy_warning_info_1: You keep your physical nodes, and your billing will remain unchanged.
nutanix_redeploy_warning_info_3: All of the data stored on your cluster will be deleted.
nutanix_redeploy_warning_info_4: Your Prism Central access codes will be regenerated.
nutanix_redeploy_warning_info_5: Your configurations in Prism Central will be deleted.
nutanix_redeploy_warning_info_6: The network configuration will be reset to the default values (IP, vRack, etc.).
nutanix_redeploy_prism_central_descripti: Prism Central is the interface you use to manage different Nutanix clusters, even if they are physically separated. The Prism Central private virtual IP can be accessed through the IP Load Balancer.
nutanix_redeploy_prism_central_type_desc: The “Type” field determines the availability level of the Prism Central virtual machine (VM) you want to apply. Each VM uses part of your cluster’s resources. The “Alone” type means that only 1 VM is deployed. The “Scale” type means that three VMs are deployed on your cluster, which allows for distributed management of Prism Central. It also makes Prism Central more resilient.
nutanix_redeploy_prism_central_virtual_i: Prism Element VIP is the cluster’s private virtual IP.
nutanix_redeploy_prism_central_ip_descri: Private IPs of Prism Central VMs.
nutanix_redeploy_replication_description: You can choose to have data (VM and Oplog) replicated two or three times within your cluster. Increased replication provides greater tolerance to incidents, but will use more storage space.
nutanix_redeploy_erasure_coding_descript: You can enable the Erasure Coding feature. This will increase the effective storage capacity, but is not recommended for servers with less than 4 nodes.
nutanix_redeploy_prism_element_vip_descr: Prism Element VIP is the cluster’s private virtual IP.
nutanix_redeploy_prism_element_gateway_c: Specify the private network that will be used for cluster deployment. The gateway of this network will be used as the OVHcloud VM IP Gateway.
nutanix_redeploy_prism_element_aos_descr: AOS is the Nutanix operating system. Choose the AOS version you want to install on all of the nodes that make up your cluster.
nutanix_redeploy_custom_config_ip_unique: This IP is already used on this cluster
nutanix_redeploy_custom_config_ip_not_in: The addresses are not on the same network.
nutanix_redeploy_custom_config_ip_format: The IP format is not correct
nutanix_redeploy_vlan_id_description: Specify the VLAN ID used for cluster deployment.
nutanix_redeploy_vlan_id_helper: VLAN ID must be between 1 and 4000.
